revised_title: Amino Acid Sequence and Function of Moult-Inhibiting Hormone in Crustaceans
tldr: The author determined the amino acid sequence of putative moult-inhibiting hormone (MIH) from the crab Carcinus maenas. MIH is a 78-residue neuropeptide with three disulphide bridges and shows some homology to the crustacean hyperglycemic hormone (CHH) neuropeptide family. This discovery provides insights into the multifunctional roles of these neuropeptides in crustacean biology.
